attributes.action: Demand the US Government formally apologise over the allegations of wiretapping.
attributes.background:
The White House has accused GCHQ of illegally spying on Donald Trump at the behest of President Obama.

The UK Government should demand, in the strongest terms, either tangible proof of this or a formal apology.

attributes.action: Raise minimum wage for night shift workers.
attributes.background: Working nights are unsociable hours, to be paid day minimum wage is wrong.  Working nights is unhealthy but someone has to do the job, by upping the nights minimum wage will help the jobs get done and the staff happier. Please help to up the minimum wage for night workers.
attributes.additional_details: Nights staff are always needed but the day minimum wage is not enough to compensate the lack of sleep and mess of routine.

attributes.action: Divert all foreign aid immediately to the looming famine in East Africa
attributes.background: We have money for the Ethiopian Spice Girls, the Indian Space Programme and the largest economy in the world. More people are going to die than ever before on Earth. We are the greatest country in the world. We must show the world that we in this Island will do the the right thing, now and forever.

attributes.action: Do not deport refugees to countries that have abused them
attributes.background: From today (15 March) the exemptions to the Dublin Regulation - the EU law governing the transfer of asylum seekers - run out. People who have suffered extreme trauma will be sent to countries that they claim have mistreated and abused them. Parliament should not allow this to happen.
attributes.additional_details:
Struggling Southern European states are disproportionately allocated asylum seekers, which remains the case even when countries are linked to serious allegations of violence against refugees. There is also a risk that the threat of deportation causes migrants in the UK to become undocumented. 

We are calling on the Government to suspend Dublin transfers and allow residents with connections here to stay. 

You can read our report here: https://www.scribd.com/document/341947352/Roads-to-Nowhere

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to guarantee rights for EU nationals living in the UK
attributes.background: MPs have voted against an amendment that would have guaranteed rights for EU nationals living in the U.K. It's a disgrace. They have been beneficial members of our society, partaking in jobs that we don't want to, bringing expertise and contributing towards the economy.
attributes.additional_details: I'm calling on the government to hold a referendum over this matter, in regards to guaranteeing rights for EU nationals in the U.K., as we enter the negotiations stage.

attributes.action: Introduce a higher rate of capital gains tax for properties left empty for years
attributes.background: With low interest rates and a weak pound, foreign ownership of properties in London has sky rocketed. This has forced up prices so that most people cannot afford to buy a house. Worse still many properties are left empty for years to accumulate in value when then forces up rents elsewhere as well.
attributes.additional_details: Introducing a scaled higher rate of capital gains tax for properties left empty for the majority of the duration of ownership would incentivise owners to rent them out, thus easing the strain on the already overheated rental market.

attributes.action: Make benefit claimants do 10 hours free work a week to help community projects.
attributes.background: As the government keeps on cutting money for councils, they have an ever growing problem of finding additional funds to do community projects. Therefore some tasks are no longer undertook by the council like they once were. This can be seen from local parks to general litter picking.
attributes.additional_details: Solving this would be to enforce that people who recieve benefits would be required to undertake 10hrs free work a week to recieve their benefits. It would help the community and also give experience to the people whom recieve them. The people whom claim benefits would have to be accessed to see if they are capable and fit to undetake the tasks of the community.

attributes.action: Award Diabeties Mellititus Type 1 sufferers the Personal Independent Plan.
attributes.background: Many diabetics are being refused the PIP because they no longer reach the criteria the government have set. Yet they were awarded the Disbility Living Allwance. My son is diabetic, and recently was refused dispite going to tribunal and being on the autistic spectrum.
attributes.additional_details: There is a new blood testing system for diabetics. It is a system that is pain free. A patch is applied to the body and a small scanner is used to record mp the blood sugars. It costs just under £60 for one patch that lasts for two weeks. It is not free in the NHS

attributes.action: Create a federal United Kingdom, giving more powers to devolved administrations.
attributes.background: The way forward for the United Kingdom is to change the way we do our politics. With the UK government and Scottish government at an impass, along with Wales and regions around England calling for greater autonomy, the reasonable solution would be to create a federalised United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
Scotland backed remaining in the UK by 45%, yet voted to leave the EU by 62%.
The Welsh government are looking for assurances after Brexit.

The way to solve this is to create an English parliament and devolve powers from Westminster to England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland.

Each government is given a greater role in overseeing their nation/region's success.

The UK government would provide responsibility in the fields of defence, the overall economy, immigration and so on.

attributes.action: Make football available across all viewing platforms at reasonable cost
attributes.background: In 2007 the European Union demanded that Premier League football TV rights be split to end the monopoly that BSkyB had over televised football in the UK. They said the new system would provide football fans with "greater choice and better value". In reality the opposite has happened.
attributes.additional_details: Football fans are now having to pay for two subscriptions in order to watch all the available matches. This hardly provides better value and is leading to the increase in illegal online streaming of matches. We would ask the government to look at this ruling, especially with the impending UK exit from the European Union, and ask that all rights holders make their HD channels available to each other on a wholesale basis to end the current system of needing two expensive subscriptions.

attributes.action: Make law and politics a core study in high school; like maths, English & science
attributes.background:
As the popular proverb suggests "knowledge is power."Thus, it seems to me our electorate is powerless! 

We complain about the turnout for elections and that people don't really understand the political and legal systems (especially 18 to 24s). So let's do something about it
attributes.additional_details:
Quite often in elections less than 50% of young people between the ages of 18 & 24 actually vote. Furthermore, it is often less than 70% of eligible voters who actually vote. 

In the general election 2015, 43% of 18 to 24s voted and only 66% of all eligible voters cast a vote. This is not good enough. 

https://www.ipsos-mori.com/researchpublications/researcharchive/3575/How-Britain-voted-in-2015.aspx

attributes.action: Replace the unelected House of Lords with a system comparable with jury service
attributes.background: Replacing the unelected House of Lords with a system comparable with a 'jury service' will enable Bills to be scrutinized apolitically thus ensuring laws can be passed or rejected on face value. No direct political loyalty should be allowed in an attempt to depoliticise the 'upper house'.

attributes.action: Prevent the return, to Britain, of British citizens that went to fight for Isis.
attributes.background: With the imminent defeat of Isis, particularly in Iraq, it would put the security of the UK at further risk if the people who went to Iraq to fight for Isis to be allowed to return to live in the U.K.

attributes.action: Curb betting adverting around football matches and ban impulse bets.
attributes.background:
A ban should be placed on betting advertising within 30 minutes of the start of football matches; and a ban should be placed on in play and 'impulse' bets and their aggressive advertising.
Firms should be forced to allow 1 minute cooling off period on all bets to stop people betting impulsively
attributes.additional_details:
Since legalisation of advertising for betting in the U.K. we have seen an increase in problematic gambling, coinciding with the rise of betting on apps and the subsequent increase in advertising spend. New demographics are targeted, the industry now intertwined with football and is impossible to ignore.
Companies are now failing in their duty of care to their customers by providing quicker and quicker ways to bet, alongside aggressively advertising odds to encourage impulsive betting patterns.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for all public officers to undertake ethics testing
attributes.background: A recent Freedom of Information request revealed that despite the publication by Central Government in 1995 of the Nolan Principles binding the conduct of all public office holders, no records currently exist in the Cabinet Office of routine ethics testing carried out across our public services
attributes.additional_details:
Sound ethical judgement is critical in attaining and maintaining public and business trust in our public services.

Whilst this argument was underpinned by the Nolan Principles in 1995, the Cabinet Office can't actually evidence today any records of routine ethics testing by staff across the population to which such principles are supposed to apply.

In today's digitally connected economy where e-tools exist to audit ethics awareness, this finding is unacceptable and can easily be addressed.

attributes.action: Make fast, MANDATORY  PIP awards to cancer patients already on lower PIP
attributes.background: Cancer patients already awarded PIP for existing illnesses have to chance losing what they have already been awarded by having to make a completely new claim when diagnosed with Cancer. Enough stress comes with Cancer without having to worry about finances and the potential loss of income.

attributes.action: Allow 16 year olds to start driving lessons.
attributes.background: Lower the legal age to start driving lessons to 16. This will allow teens to start driving and prepare people to start driving once they are 17. A friend of mine started driving lessons at 17 and only got his license at 23 years of age. The struggle is real.

attributes.action: Create Protocol for Government Intervention in Strikes (e.g. Southern stalemate)
attributes.background: We would like to petition the government to seriously contemplate introducing a system in which labour disputes involving services essential to our economy, such as the Southern rail strike, can be handled in the case of long-running disruption and lack of agreement between the principle parties.
attributes.additional_details:
We ask the that government consider methods implemented by other nations, for example Canada, where the options include binding arbitration [For more information: http://www.cbc.ca/1.1000525]

Though we cannot quantify what the Southern rail strike has cost the economy, it certainly has had an effect; ramifications on citizens' lives must also be appreciated. In situations such as these, it would be beneficial to have a governmental framework in place. 

With thanks for your consideration.

attributes.action: Stop paying subsidies for renewables because they are adding CO2 not reducing it
attributes.background: The thermal efficiency of Closed Cycle Gas Turbines (CCGTs) when ramping up and down in response to wind generation drops for up to 4 hours and each end of the ramping process. This increases the amount of gas that is burned so that 35kg of CO2 is emitted for every MWh generated by wind generation.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/comment/9559656/Germanys-wind-power-chaos-should-be-a-warning-to-the-UK.html

http://www.heraldscotland.com/opinion/letters/15087524.Renewables_has_so_far_been_failed_experiment/

attributes.action: Decision on brexit should need 2nd poll if it involves exit from customs union
attributes.background: The customs union and free trade area were not referred to on the ballot paper in the referendum and could have had an effect on the result if it had been stated on the ballot paper. The UK population should have a final say on all implications if leaving the above is part of the Brexit deal

attributes.action: Repeal and replace the NFAOP act 1861 with something new and up to date
attributes.background: The best ways in which parliament could update this act is by putting the offences of ABH and GBH in the same act as battery and assault so the law is more concise. In addition to this they could actually define what GBH and ABH is rather than leaving it to the courts to define.
attributes.additional_details: This act is used daily. It is over 150 years old, and lacks key definitions. It is an extremely important act of Parliament, even being considered the workhorse of the legal system by some. The courts themselves have had to define key terms including what constitutes as ABH (Chan Fook) and what constitutes as Wounding (Eisenhower). It shouldn't be left to the courts to decide what Parliament meant when writing the acts as Parliament should have done a good enough job in defining these terms.

attributes.action: Abolish naturalisation fees for any EU migrant who exercises EU treaty rights
attributes.background: Estimated 2.9 million people from EU live in the UK at the moment and contribute to the culture and the economy of UK. It's estimated that "the net fiscal contribution of migrants from the ten central and eastern European countries that joined the EU in 2004 or 2007 was almost £5 billion".
attributes.additional_details: We do contribute to the culture and enrich tradition in this multicultural country. In full respect to the law which allows EU members to stay in the UK, we'd like to ask for the fees to be abolished as a recognition for the contributions we made to the society.

attributes.action: Dual train (mental health and physical health) paramedics and nurses
attributes.background: Any individual who is training to become a paramedic or nurse does not have to have any mental health training. With more and more people developing mental health issues, all medical professionals; especially frontline ones, should have mental health training alongside their medical training.
attributes.additional_details: The problem is evident all over the country; more people who are in a mental health crisis or who have a history of mental health issues are calling 999, paramedics are sent to these individuals but because they are not usually physically unwell they are either assessed and left, or taken to hospital, where A&E doctors evaluate their physical health and once that is given the OK they are sent home, with no intervention from mental health services and usually the cycle starts again...

attributes.action: Prevent the rise in tuition fees under the TEF for university students
attributes.background: The TEF is the teaching excellence framework, an idea which in itself is not necessarily negative and will attempt to bring universities to a similar standard however the rise in fees associated with the cash incentives, some universities would see a steady increase in already climbing tuition fees.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.savethestudent.org/news/whats-the-deal-with-the-tef.html

attributes.action: Increase national insurance contributions by £5 a person a month to save the NHS
attributes.background:
The NHS is in crisis. I'm sure most if not everyone would be happy to pay an extra £5 a month in national insurance contributions to help save our special health care system. 
We cannot lose the NHS, or is that what the conservative government want...

attributes.action: Reduce taxes for U30s that earn below £25,000
attributes.background: It is a constant struggle for those who are starting a career , whilst living somewhere where there are a number of career opportunities.  A tax break would help with rents and affordability of life, and reduce debt for those starting off their own life.

attributes.action: Let 15 year olds apply for their provisional without having to wait 9 months.
attributes.background: Some teenagers are in stress of having to wait 9 months for a provisional, and I believe that if we lower the age of applying for a provisional, it would really help. Also, if teenagers start driving with experienced drivers at a younger age it would help them drive better in the future.
attributes.additional_details: Also, in emergency cases, if the experienced person is injured or is in need of help the teenager could help by driving to the local hospital or home etc.

attributes.action: Make Social Services & Cafcas accountable & transparent by using audio recording
attributes.background: Social Services & Cafcas get it wrong too much. Innocent families have children removed and families needing intervention go ignored. Errors are made in the reports and systems. Interviews not accurately relayed and misinterpreted. They need to be held to account and interviews audio recorded.
attributes.additional_details: Social Services fabricated evidence in my social chronology, misinterpreted information and made duplicate entries without changing dates so it's obvious the errors. Biased opinions are relied on and facts and evidence presented ignored so we are unable to address these. Complaints are passed to nhs and back to Ss. Theses incorrect opinions and documents are relied on. Making complaints is used against us. Cafcas & Social Services also record opinions and misconstrue interview content.

attributes.action: Parental responsibility should be transferred to the parent who has residency.
attributes.background: Currently the law indicates that Parental Responsibility is those who have legal rights and responsibilities for the child's upbringing, who can make decisions regarding schooling, name changes etc. I want the government to debate if the law should be amended in the cases where a parent wants no
attributes.additional_details: further contact with a child and cases of harm to the child, for the responsibility and decision making to be transferred over to the remaining parent. My sons father is unable to see his son due to the CAFCASS report and he also informed court he wants no further contact. I have changed my sons surname by Deedpoll but passport etc needs authorisation and permission from the father, even in these circumstances when all evidence shown. These rights should be abolished.

attributes.action: Free childcare hour from their 3rd birthday
attributes.background:
In Scotland children from their 3rd birthday get their free hours of child care but in England we have to wait until the next term.
I would like every child on their 3rd birthday to get their free hours

attributes.action: Introduce a new 'National Health Tax' which is only to be used for NHS.
attributes.background: Most people in the UK seem to be happy with paying extra to fund the NHS. An new NHT would target funds directly to where they are needed and not form part of a central pot. NHT could be applied to the following: Petrol and diesel, Alcohol, tobacco, UK visitors at port of entry (£25.00) etc
attributes.additional_details:
NHT would be in addition to VAT but NOT be applied to direct income.
For example current VAT at 20% could be raised to 21% to include 1% NHT. The government could no longer be blamed for not having enough cash as the NHT would be a disclosed figure and allocated directly. We should also reduce grants to the FA and other organisations not in need and reduce overseas aid. This saving can be converted as an NHT income.

attributes.action: Amend the Aggravated Murder of and  Violence against Women Bill to include men
attributes.background: The Bill had its first reading in Parliament on the 31st January 2017. The obvious thing that was picked up by one member of parliament, that being Philip Davies, was that he recognised that the bill was sexist. How it got approved is beyond comprehension.

attributes.action: For the PM to notify the UK’s intention to withdraw from the EU on 25 March 2017
attributes.background: The people of the UK voted on 23rd June 2017 to leave the EU. The bill to withdraw is currently passing through Parliament. Once passed, it would be fitting for the Prime Minister to notify, under Article 50(2) of the Treaty on EU, the UK’s intention to withdraw from the EU on 25th March 2017.

attributes.action: Subsidise public transport for all UK citizens
attributes.background: We have a chicken and egg situation with our bus and train services. The huge costs of using public transport discourage people from using trains and buses，preferring to use cars instead. But the investment to improve the public transport system cannot be justified if not enough people use it.
attributes.additional_details: Measured in cost per mile travelled， the UK train service is up to ten times greater than other developed countries. The public understand the environmental need to reduce dependence on cars but cannot afford to do so. Increasing taxes on car usage is laudable but the cash incentive to use public transport is missing at present. The UK citizens should be incentivised with hugely reduced ticket prices， on presentation of a passport or other UK ID card.

attributes.action: Litter Tax and 100%  of that Tax goes to Picking up that Litter
attributes.background: The tax would support volunteers who litter pick ie transport to litter picking events , refreshments and a Register so volunteers could have a record of their contribution to society which could be used in CV's for example.
attributes.additional_details:
Tax worked out as a percentage of litter, so if  crisps made up 8% of litter they would pay 8% of that tax, then they would pass additional costs onto their customers. Basically those who drop it will pay for it to be cleaned up the company would then look for ways to encourage their customers to dispose of empty packets properly. 
People could put areas forward that need a clean with photos then a simple voting system photos of winning area after and during clean to show the system is working.

attributes.action: Forbid creation of any rule that isn't gender neutral by government bodies
attributes.background:
The UK government and police have been creating discriminatory rules which only apply to a subset of the population. It is critical we always write rules to be fair and protect all.

forbid the creation of any government backed rules which are not gender, race, disability and sexuality neutral
attributes.additional_details:
The government just agreed on a new bill which only includes female victims of so called "honour killings" despite as many as 1 in 4 victims of honour killing victims being male.
here : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0MgKWxlCWb0&ab_channel=TheDeplorables

Nottingham shire also introduced hate crime rules which only when committed against a women.
here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ya3ssMJPRJo&ab_channel=BBCNews

attributes.action: UK should allocate more of its aid and development money to endangered species
attributes.background:
A proviso should be added to the aid and development money that we provide to Africa, that some of the money must to go towards endangered species.
Hopefully if the UK put aside more funds for endangered species, the African governments will also make a change.

attributes.action: Negotiate freedom of movement with Canada after Britain leaves the EU.
attributes.background: Both Great Britain and Canada would be greatly benefited by having freedom of movement.

attributes.action: Build A Road Link From Great Britain To Northern Ireland
attributes.background:
I'd like to see a road link be built with either a bridge or tunnel from the mainland (Great Britain), to Northern Ireland.
Not only would this connect the whole of the UK, but I belive would benefit trade between the home nations.
All of a sudden, Northern Ireland would be much more accessible.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-23672538

https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=/amp/www.scotsman.com/business/companies/could-a-bridge-or-tunnel-one-day-link-scotland-with-ireland-1-4130353/amp&ved=0ahUKEwiQpvja_fTRAhUrBcAKHUxXA0UQFggpMAE&usg=AFQjCNFu7YCXfYxhQLc5wcsOrzUFPaKjRA&sig2=_FE223uc_ZiJK6gyYXPuMA

http://www.railforums.co.uk/showthread.php?t=35376

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Irish_Sea_fixed_crossing

attributes.action: Introduce free drug purity test kits into Pharmacies across Britain.
attributes.background: Too many young individuals are taking drugs that in most cases are not what they are said to be, leading to cases of serious harm and often death. Drug consumption is not something that can be stopped, but can be made safer with the introduction of these purity testing kits that could save lifes.

attributes.action: Make Energy Companies pay for the roll out of Smart Meters.
attributes.background: Electricity companies are rolling out Smart Meters at a cost of 11 Billion to their customers. They should be footing the bill from their profits and Government should introduce legislation to protect the rights of consumers.

attributes.action: Give new and expectant mothers 6 months to pursue discrimination claims.
attributes.background: Mothers are being let down.The Equality and Human Rights Commission reported that 77% of women had experienced discrimination in the workplace due to pregnancy or maternity. However, a restrictive time-limit of 3 months is one of the reasons less than 1% of these are pursued to Tribunal. #GiveMeSix
attributes.additional_details:
Pregnancy and maternity discrimination is subtle by nature. For new and expectant mothers, dealing with this can be overwhelming. Many women won’t have the strength to tackle the issue immediately. Attempting to deal with this could put the health of the mother and unborn child at risk.

A 6 month time-limit would give mothers that little bit of breathing space. Help us reach 100,000 signatures so the 54,000 women a year who lose their jobs for being pregnant have greater access to justice.

attributes.action: Ban Employers from rejecting applicants without giving feedback.
attributes.background: I woulf like to see the government prevent Employers rejecting candidates particularly after and interview without giving feedback on where sed candidate went wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
"Thank you for taking part in the recent assessment for the position of Online Driver.

While you demonstrated some of the skills we’re looking for, after careful consideration we regret to inform you that you have been unsuccessful"  Thank you for taking part in the recent assessment for the position of Online Driver.

While you demonstrated some of the skills we’re looking for, after careful consideration we regret to inform you that you have been unsuccessful Something like this isnt helpful.

attributes.action: Set a goal of landing a person on the Moon by 2050.
attributes.background: A lot of people feel that the United Kingdom no longer has a sense of unity or direction in the wake of the EU referendum. Setting this goal would bring it back, as well as boosting industry and encouraging skilled workers to remain in the UK. It would also help our position as part of ESA.
attributes.additional_details: Only a few countries in the world are capable of launching humans into space and sadly neither the UK nor any member states of the European Space Agency have this capability. By setting this goal we will send a clear message to the world that we are still looking to be at the for front of technical innovation and achievement. It will also raise public awareness of the UK's satellite industry and encourage more people to get involved in science and technology.

attributes.action: Declare smoking in public areas a criminal offence
attributes.background: Smoking is a choice and no-one should be punished for the choices of another. Smoking should be made illegal in public areas to assist non-smokers who do not wish to be in contact with the toxic fumes of second-hand smoke.
attributes.additional_details: Everyone's needed to walk past someone smoking in public and needing to hold their breath to avoid inhaling the toxic fumes. Every year, second-hand smoke kills thousands of people in the UK from lung cancer, heart disease, strokes and the lung disease COPD. Second-hand smoke has been linked to around 165,000 new cases of disease among children in the UK each year. Passive smoking may also increase the risk of cancers of the larynx and pharynx.

attributes.action: Make Queen's birthday a national holiday
attributes.background: Make the Queen's birthday (the 21st of April) a UK wide public holiday.

attributes.action: Postpone Brexit by a year until we find out how US will be under new president
attributes.background: The USA president has issued several executive orders some of which are in contravention of international norms. There could be repercussions internationally and until we know the long term outcome we should not trigger Brexit just now which would mean reliance on an unstable trading partner of USA.
attributes.additional_details: Trump has issued many executive orders already, one of which is in contravention of the Geneva Convention on refugees. In retaliation at the ban on nationals from seven Muslim countries, Iran and Iraq are already discussing banning US nationals. This could produce further instability in an the Middle East. It would be naive of the UK to exit the single market and rely on trade with a country that not only disregards international norms but could alienate our other trading partners. Wait a year.

attributes.action: Reinstate Functional Skills as an alternative for Level 3 EYE's
attributes.background: I am concerned that in 2014, the government altered the requirements for those taking Level 3 in EYE and now, all Level 3 EYE's must have at least a C grade in GCSE English and maths to count in the ratios - with equitable alternatives such as Functional Skills no longer considered as an option.
attributes.additional_details: Potential new recruits, who have all the skills, including good English and maths, to be excellent Early Years Educators, will be barred from the sector. Its only a matter of time before we do not have the practitioners to fill the much needed roles which will have catastrophic impact on the Early Years sector, and in turn on parents and children. 30 hours free Child care is on its way.

attributes.action: Ban Donald Trump from the UK and tell US House of Representitives to impeach him
attributes.background: The people of the UK, and indeed the world are becoming increasingly alarmed by the beliefs, policies and actions of Donald Trump ( POTUS ) We ask our government to ban Donald Trump from making any visit to the UK, and put pressure on The US House of representitves to impeach Donald Trump.

attributes.action: Offer more funds to councils to fix the roads
attributes.background: I have had 3 tyre punctures on my car due to the road surface being really bad.
attributes.additional_details: The roads in Oxford are pretty bad, council is not fixing them due to lack of funds.
